result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:21 am 
INCLUDES 14CF5 AND 14CF54. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Rick Cveykus. 
Atty Cveykus withdraws filed motion. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF5: Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent THC)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>D&RI.
               : Ct. 5 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 6 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 7 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 9 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF54: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 14CF5: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Cveykus makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; 75 days MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def is eligible under jail criteria imposed and STAYED for rule violations; DNA sample; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 285 days jail credit if revoked. 
Adj: 9:39 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:00 am 
INCLUDES 14CF5 AND 14CF54. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft does NOT appear as his appearance is not necessary - Atty Rick Cveykus appears on his behalf. 
Date and Time was set for Motion Hearing. 
COURT notes State indicated prior to going on the record new discovery was found and needs to be furnished to the defense. 
State notes discovery will be given to the defense as soon as copies are made. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set Status Conference in a week. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 9:02 am
Status conference on October 23, 2014 at 09:50 am.
Motion hearing on October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Clerk Marisa.

COURT questions parties regarding motion. COURT sets parameters regarding questioning. 
R.W. sworn and testifies. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling regarding expectation of privacy. 
State notes discovery to be turned over to defense counsel. 
COURT sets matter for calendar call for 8/27/2014 at 1pm. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 1:51 pm
Motion hearing on August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

INCLUDES 14CF54 & 14CF5.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.  No contact with victim(s): C.X., F.V., G.C. & A.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:54 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF5 AND 14CF54. 
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Rick Cveykus. 
Date and Time set for hearing on deft's motion for bond modification. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - modifies bond to $50,000 cash - CONDITIONS: Attic Day report; no contact with co-defts GC, AH, CX, and FV; absolute sobriety - bond to cover both files. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to schedule future dates.
